About Me

Hello.

Callforce

Full Stack Software Engineer
May, 2020 to Present

Callforce provides solutions for patient outreach, answering services and appointment handling, insurance verification, and other unique services to dental offices. I worked alongside FANG-experienced engineers on internal tools, such as an employee console for handling appointments and a list-filtering software that would orgnanize patient records into csvs, for our callers to contact, as well as an external, client-facing portal for our customers to view their patient's appointments through our services.

Skills
  • Underwent HIPAA compliance training for adequately handling patient-sensitive data.
  • Emphatically used React, Node, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform technologies (BigQuery, CRON jobs through Pubsubs, storage, VM instances, cloud-functions), SQL, Material-UI, Tailwind, and
  • Improved the readability of my code from learning alongside Adobee and Amazon engineers who gave constructive feedback on my PRs.
Accomplishments
  • Client offered $20,000 to have a custom built insurance verification table in the client-portal for viewing statuses of patient insurances. I completed this in 2 days.
  • Uncovered and fixed buggy code, not related to my assignments, that prevented Callforce's notification system (email and SMS updates) from working properly.
  • Created better, structured google cloud logs, outside of my assignments, for better error visibility in our more frequently used cloud-functions.
Projects
  • DSO (Dental Service Organization) List Filtering Electron Application
    • Built an electron application for DSOs that filtered, sorted, and consolidated millions of patient records based on shared phone numbers and outputed office-specific csvs.
    • Patient records were consolidated based on their primary phone numbers.
    • Filtered by either pediatric/non-pediatric requirements (age-ranges), if patient had medicare, if patient was overdue for an appointment (often over 6 months since last appointment), and etc.
    • Sorted by age for conslidated patient records once groupings of shared phone numbers were identified.
  • Dental Office List Filtering Cloud-Functions for Practice Management Softwares
    • Built cloud-functions to support non-DSO dental office list filtering that returned csvs that would then be uploaded into the five9 queue for callers to call upon.
    • The supported Practice Management Softwares supported in these list-filtering cloud-functions: Curve, Denticon, Dentrix, DentrixAscend, EagleSoft, Open Dental, Mac Practice, and Practice Works.
    • Multiple scenes constructed for sole office list handling within our internal console that supported many list uploads simultaneously. Lists would be uploaded, requested to a cloud-function to be sorted/filtered/consolidated, and would be filtered by utility functions specific to the PMS (Practice Management Software - e.g. Dentrix) that generated the patient list.
    • Effect: Reduced operation overhead by supporting multiple lists filtering simultaneously, dividing DSO lists into office-level csvs for better accountability and handling among teams, prevented multiple calls on the same patient, and greatly sped up production of calls by eliminating filtering by hand.
  • Client-Facing Portal
    • Have built many cloud-functions onRequest, onCall, pubsub, and etc

Independent Contractor

React/WordPress Developer
Nov, 2019 to Nov, 2020

I worked as a React developer for AccenaGroup on a map-editing tool for water inspectors leveraging the Konva library for shape building, and I also worked as a WordPress developer for retailconsultingteam.

  • Experience in cPanel, DNS updates, API service calls, GIT version control, hosting, file management, and creating sharp themes in WordPress using Divi.
  • Update clients daily on requested features and any issues encountered, and implement technologies that best serve the project.
  • Link to RetailConsultingTeam.

Bright Bridge Web

Project Manager && Full Stack Web Developer
Feb, 2019 to Nov, 2019

As an employee at Bright Bridge, I largely worked as a frontend developer specializing in React. Some of the more notable projects I engineered include ScriptureNotes study tool (learn more at scripturenotes.com) and ComplianceGo's Map Editor Tool (functionality will be greatly limited as a public user). I also managed development teams for IAchieveToday and the EventBookingPro app.

  • Correspond with clients with daily updates.
  • Lead weekly standups with task lists and roadmaps, and give directional advice on how to approach complex problems.
  • Keep progress on our weekly goals with end of week reports to share with our clients.
  • Prepare estimates for feature implementations and bug fixes.
  • Organize my teams in a way that play to my team members' strengths while offering room for them to improve upon their weaknesses.
  • I have experience working on UIs and APIs in Django and React.js in Git version control, WordPress, React Native, as well as with working in older legacy code projects using SFTP.
